position.marginalia_text: Bionis Epitaphium. Henrici 4. Epinicion. Aschami discursus Germanicus.
Instructions for trauellers. Eliots French dialogs. Heywoods prouerbs, & Epigrams.

book.title: The Proverbs, Epigrams, and Miscellanies of John Heywood

position.marginalia_text: Tria scuta heroica: Herculis, Achillis, A[e]nea[e]: apud Hesiodu[m], Homeru[m], Virgiliu[m]. Quibus nihil apud excellentiss[im]os Gra[e]cos aut Romanos in flore, vel prudentius, vel fortius, vel omninò validus, aut admirabilius. Techna[e] contractuu[m] pragmatica[e], in arte Notariatus: et Vilsoni dialogis de Vsura.

marginalia.translation: Bion of Smyrna's 'Epitaph of Adonis', 'The triumph of Henry IV', Roger Ascham's 'Report and Discourse'. Instruction for trauellers. John Eliot's 'Ortho-epia gallica', John Heywood's 'The Proverbs, Epigrams, and Miscellanies of John Heywood'. Three heroic shields: of Hercules, Achilles, and Aeneas; in Hesiod, Homer, and Virgil. To whom no one can be either more prudent, strong, altogether powerful or admirable among the most excellent Greeks and Romans in their youthful prime. Pragmatic tricks of contracts in the art of a notary, and in Thomas Wilson's 'A discourse upon usurie'.
